data.en: My projects in near-reverse chronological order.</br></br>

data.all:
Current research, part of the Undergraduate Research Opportunity Program at the University of Michigan with Professor Mark Guzdial.
As part of this research I am developing an educational visual programming language to help educators teach graph theory concepts in computer science and programming through the context of social studies, geography, and the physical sciences. All graphics from scratch.
Frameworks: HTML+SVG, Javascript, WebGL
Repository: https://github.com/AjjMarx/TeaspoonGraph
Interactive: ajjmarx.github.io/TeaspoonGraph/

Youre here right now! Read my blog post to learn more about developing this page and my goals for the site.
Repository: github.com/AjjMarx/ajjmarx.github.io/

data.en_hover: Papercrafts of Cats, Tree, Teddy Bear, Bananas, and Apple

data.all: Papercrafts designed in Blender and released online for hundreds of thousands of crafter to recreate at home on their home devices! Generated >$1100 in ad revenue and 240k views.
3Blue1Brown Summer of Math Exposition #2 (2023, WCC)

Online fully animated and narrated video created in Blender for the 3Blue1Brown summer of math exposition #2. My video explains the geometric principals of Fortune's Algorithm for generating Voronoi diagrams. Topics include: Voronoi Diagrams, metric spaces, 3D graphing, geometry, algebra. Placed within top third of participants and made it to final judging.

Extra Credits Game Jam: Paper Stapler
(2019, High School)

Weekend game jam run by the Video Game Design youtube Channel extra credits, theme: cycles. My submission was a simple game with the objective to align papers to staple them together. Selected to be presented in final video out of 261 submissions.
Framework: Pico-8
Play here!

Of them, I decided to design a small self-contained computer from logic gates. Looking back, it is clearly not very good or functional but it was very much fun.</br></br>
